title: Rocky
content:
What's wrong with Rocky, the current featured typeface?

Nothing.

It's not too fat, too thin, too wide, too narrow, unbalanced in any way.

Not too showy, not too bland.

It just sits there being perfectly readable, gracious, calmly doing its job.

Amazing.
author: William Berkson

_Nothing, except the $1,000 tag for a single license._

There's always some complaint about price. Perhaps thinking about it as $25/style puts it into perspective. Without starting another price/flame thread, what do _you_ think is a "fair" price, Nathan?

Well Kris Sowersby,

Without starting another price flame thread, given your occupation (your work is very nice btw), it would be mightly foolish to respond to your loaded question with a figure. Any figure stated will likely not be sufficient - justifiably so from your view of the world.

In the _real consumer world_ though, $1,000 for a single license, where we are not given an _option_ to select _some_ styles is a little ridiculous.

Given the **make once, sell many** , nature of type, would it not be more sensible to have a mid-range pricing point?

Rocky is brilliant. 30 mins ago, FB would have had another sale if it weren't for the price. I and many others have some good money for type designers to collect - please make it a little more accessible - or provide some _options_.

Rocky is brilliant and I don't wish to divert the direction of the OP's comments.

Boxing match: Rocky vs. Greta vs. Sunday Times Modern

Who wins?!

\>Rocky vs. Greta vs. Sunday Times Modern

If I'm not mistaken, Rocky is a headline face, as is Sunday Times Modern. The Sunday Times now uses Greta Text for text, but you can't really compare it to the other two because of the different function.

There is a [Greta Display and Greta Grande](http://web.archive.org/web/20131107211722/http:/www.typotheque.com/fonts/), but as I said over at [Typographica](http://web.archive.org/web/20131107211722/http:/typographica.org/001139.php), I find them too sparkly, whereas Greta text is a real winner, one of the "best of 2007." For headlines I would prefer both Rocky and Sunday Times Modern to the display versions of Greta.

For headline, from what I see online--not the best test--I definitely prefer Rocky. It has the combination of weight, balance and bite that seems to me just right for headlines. I don't know about the issue of weights that one reviewer of the new Sunday Times brought up, but I'm pretty confident that all of the weights and widths of Rocky would work well, given that Carter drew it.

Incidentally, I prefer Rocky to "Postoni" the Headline Bodoni that Carter drew for the Washington Post. It is also very good, though, and I know it well as I look at it every morning. I'd rather see Rocky though.

"Type is just so expensive these days."

I don't see how. Type is far cheaper now than ever in history.

ChrisL

Nathan—You're right, my question was loaded, sorry. Luckily you can buy single styles! Which ones did you license?

Mikey—Type is not expensive, really. But we've been over this…
